p: However, the challenge for policy-makers is considerable. The radical change required to limit warming to 1.5 °C, is likely to lead to some difficult policy trade-offs and tensions between respecting the planetary boundaries and building adequate social foundations globally. The IPCC (2018, p 19) state that while some synergies are possible, “mitigation options consistent with 1.5 °C pathways are associated with multiple trade-offs across the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs)”.
